data.enText: to change your opinions or plans, for example because of sth you have learned

data.chText: 我明白我现在不得不改变对他的能力的看法了。
data.enText: I can see I will have to revise my opinions of his abilities now.

data.chText: 政府可能需要根据这份报告改变其政策。
data.enText: The government may need to revise its policy in the light of this report.
to change sth, such as a book or an estimate, in order to correct or improve it
a revised edition of a textbook

data.chText: 我将为你准备一份经过修正的评估报告。
data.enText: I'll prepare a revised estimate for you.

data.chText: 我们也许要将这个数字往上调一调。
data.enText: We may have to revise this figure upwards.
to prepare for an exam by looking again at work that you have done

data.chText: 我花了整个周末复习备考。
data.enText: I spent the weekend revising for my exam.

data.chText: 我今晚不能出去。我得复习。
data.enText: I can't come out tonight. I have to revise.

simple_means.memory_skill: re 一再 + vis 看 + e → 一看再看 → 一改再改 → 修正

ex.chText: 由于家长们反对，学校已经修改了计划。
ex.enText: The college has revised its plans because of objections from the parents.

ex.chText: 他们已经对经济增长的预估数据作了修正。
ex.enText: They have revised their estimates of economic growth.

synonyms.bx: 多指因为有新的内容或想法而修改。

ex.chText: 该合同经过修改变更了最后期限。
ex.enText: The contract was amended to change the deadline.

ex.chText: 目击证人后来修改了证词。
ex.enText: The witness later amended his evidence.

synonyms.bx: 指对书面或口头的内容做些许更正。

ex.enText: The manuscript was emended by the author.

ex.chText: 她只负责修改那部书中的一节。
ex.enText: She was only responsible for emending one passage in that book.

tr: revise or reorganize, especially for the purpose of updating and improving
example: We must retool the town's economy

value.def: If you revise the way you think about something, you adjust your thoughts, usually in order to make them better or more suited to how things are.

example.ex: He soon came to revise his opinion of the profession.
example.tran: 他很快就改变了对这个职业的看法。

value.def: If you revise a price, amount, or estimate, you change it to make it more fair, realistic, or accurate.

example.ex: They realised that some of their prices were higher than their competitors' and revised prices accordingly...
example.tran: 他们意识到自己有些价格高于竞争对手，就相应调整了价格。

example.ex: The United Nations has been forced to revise its estimates of population growth upwards.
example.tran: 联合国已经被迫上调了其对人口增长做出的预测。

value.tran: 调整，改变(价格、数目、估计等)

value.def: When you revise an article, a book, a law, or a piece of music, you change it in order to improve it, make it more modern, or make it more suitable for a particular purpose.

example.ex: Three editors handled the work of revising the articles for publication...
example.tran: 3位编辑负责文章的修订出版工作。

example.ex: The staff should work together to revise the school curriculum.
example.tran: 全体教职工应当齐心协力修订学校课程。

value.tran: 修改（音乐作品）；修订（法律）；审定，校订（文章、书籍）

value.def: When you revise for an examination, you read things again and make notes in order to be prepared for the examination.

example.ex: I have to revise for maths...
I'd better skip the party and stay at home to revise.
example.tran: 我最好还是不去参加这个聚会，留在家里温习功课。

value.boxr_value: in AM, use 美国英语用 review

partsOfSpeech.dec: ad 做… + vis 看 + e → 使〔别人〕看到 → 劝告
ad 做… + vis 看 + ory …的 → 劝告的
en 使… + vis 看 + age 表行为 → 看 → 想象
e 出 + vid 看 + ence 性质，状态，行为 → 证据
e 出 + vid 看 + ent 具有…性质的，关于…的 → 看出来了 → 明显的
im 不 + provident 深谋远虑的 → 没有远见的，有钱就花 → 浪费的
in 使… + vid 看 + ious …的 → 让人看 →〔易〕招嫉妒的
pre 预先 + vis 看 + e → 预先看 → 预知
pro 在前 + vid 看 + e → 提前看好 → 预备
pro 向前 + vid 看 + ent 具有…性质的，关于…的 → 向前看的 → 有远见的 → 深谋远虑的
pro 向前 + vision 眼界 + al …的 → 眼前的 → 临时的
re 一再 + vis 看 + e → 一看再看 → 一改再改 → 修正
re 一再 + vis 看 + ion，revise 的名词 → 修正；校订本
super 上 + vis 看 + e → 在上面看 → 监督
vis 看 + ible 可…的 → 可见的
vis 看 + ion 表名词 → 视力；眼界
vision 视力；眼界 + ary …的 → 幻想的
vis 看 + ual 有…性质的 → 视力的
visual 视力的 + ize …化 → 使〔大家〕看到 → 使具体化
de 加强 + vis 分开 + e → 由古义“分开”转化而来
di 二 + vid 分开 + e → 一分为二 → 分开
di 二，两 + vis 分开 + ion 表名词 → 分开
di 二，两 + vid 分开 + end 表抽象名词 → 一变二，二变多 → 股息
in 不 + di 二，两 + vid 分开 + ual 有…性质的 → 不能分开的 → 个人的
